alfredsnippet.snippet:
Fred Hoyle, Home is where the wind blows, p.107

"Many forms of theory appear at first sight to be possible, although, in the end, one particular theory will almost surely come to seem 'deeper' and more elegant than the others, with a future generation thinking the outcome should have been obvious, just as we tend to think the outcome of struggles in physics in the past should have been obvious."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Hoyle on the Obviousness of Elegant Theories
